questions.question: Which planet is known to support life?
questions.answer: Earth

questions.question: How many billion years ago was the solar system formed?
questions.answer: 4.5 billion

questions.question: After how many years did water bodies form on Earth?
questions.answer: 80 crore

questions.question: Where did the first life forms appear?
questions.answer: Water

questions.question: What are unicellular organisms called?
questions.answer: Protozoa

questions.question: Which instrument is used to see protozoa?
questions.answer: Microscope

questions.question: Which planet is called the Red Planet?
questions.answer: Mars

questions.question: Which gas is present in large amount in Mars atmosphere?
questions.answer: Carbon dioxide

questions.question: Animals which lay eggs belong to which group?
questions.answer: Some animals

questions.question: Which is NOT a characteristic of animals?
questions.answer: Photosynthesis

questions.question: How many planets revolve around the sun?
Which planet has ice at the poles?
questions.answer: Mars

questions.question: What is essential for life to exist?
questions.answer: Liquid water

questions.question: Which spacecraft did India send to Mars?
questions.answer: Mangalyaan

questions.question: In which year was Mangalyaan launched?

questions.question: How many billion years ago was the solar system formed?

questions.question: After how many years did water bodies form on Earth?
questions.answer: 80 crore

questions.question: Where did the first life forms appear?
questions.answer: Water

questions.question: What are unicellular organisms called?
questions.answer: Protozoa

questions.question: What is meant by life on Earth?
questions.answer: Life on Earth refers to the existence of living organisms on the planet Earth.

questions.question: When was the solar system formed?
questions.answer: The solar system was formed about 4.5 billion years ago.

questions.question: Why is Earth unique among planets?
questions.answer: Earth is the only planet known to support life.

questions.question: When did water bodies appear on Earth?
questions.answer: Water bodies appeared about 80 crore years after Earth cooled.

questions.question: Where did life first begin?
questions.answer: Life first began in water.

questions.question: What are protozoa?
questions.answer: Protozoa are unicellular living organisms.

questions.question: Why are protozoa not visible to naked eyes?
questions.answer: They are extremely small in size.

questions.question: Which tool helps us see unicellular organisms?
questions.answer: A microscope helps us see unicellular organisms.

questions.question: Name any two characteristics of animals.
questions.answer: Animals breathe and can move.

questions.question: How do animals reproduce?
questions.answer: Some animals lay eggs while others give birth.

questions.question: How was the sun formed?
questions.answer: The sun was formed from a huge cloud of hot gases and dust.

questions.question: How were planets formed?
questions.answer: Planets were formed from parts of the gas cloud revolving around the sun.

questions.question: Name the planets in the solar system.
questions.answer: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.

questions.question: Why was life expected on Mars?
questions.answer: Because Mars has ice, atmosphere and soil components.

questions.question: Why does life not exist on Mars?
questions.answer: Because liquid water is not present on Mars.

questions.question: What gases are present on Mars?
questions.answer: Mars has carbon dioxide and small amounts of oxygen.

questions.question: What is Mangalyaan?
questions.answer: Mangalyaan is India's Mars mission spacecraft.

questions.question: When did Mangalyaan reach Mars?
questions.answer: Mangalyaan reached Mars on 24 September 2014.

questions.question: What do animals need to survive?
questions.answer: Animals need food, water and air to survive.

questions.question: What two groups make up the living world?
questions.answer: Plants and animals make up the living world.
